properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 25 at 3:30PM HST until January 27 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU
KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...

...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND...

.The current large long-period northwest swell will peak tonight,
then gradually lower Sunday into early next week.

* WHAT...Surf of 6 to 10 feet along west facing shores of the Big
Island through Sunday, then lowering to 5 to 8 feet Sunday
night.

* WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break,
and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming
difficult and dangerous.
properties.instruction:
Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by
ocean safety officials and exercise caution. Boaters should
expect recreational surfers and body boarders utilizing harbor
channels to access surfing areas.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST MONDAY
